pullRequest.title: Implement views code for ES7.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description

Motivation and Context


This PR is adding the required code to support views for Elasticsearch
7. It consists of the views code from ES6 being copied over and adjusted
to use the related classes/methods from ES7.
How Has This Been Tested?



Screenshots (if appropriate):
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Refactoring (non-breaking change)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

Checklist:



 My code follows the code style of this project.
 My change requires a change to the documentation.
 I have updated the documentation accordingly.
 I have read the CONTRIBUTING document.
 I have added tests to cover my changes.

afterCommit.message: Adding events index mapping for ES7.

afterCommit.message: Fixing extraction of document count from initial search result.

nodes.bodyText: Unused return value. Let's make this void to get rid of the warning.
Unused return value. Let's make this void to get rid of the warning.
previousAggregation can only be null here
I don't understand why we need the InitialBucket class here, if all we are interested in subsequently is SearchResponse#getAggregations.
Wouldn't it be enough to pass queryResult::getAggregations instead of initialResult?
I'm not sure we need this class (see comments on ESPivot above).

If value is null, metricAggregation will also be null, because otherwise value will have been set in the else if clause above.
I think we can log an error in the else if block instead and get rid of this block.
Variable is redundant. We can return clientRequestCaptor.getValue(); directly.

I don't think it's worth having a base class for one method (objectMapperProvider is unused). At this point I'd prefer making indicesOf static and throw it into a utility class in org.graylog.storage.elasticsearch.testing

nodes.bodyText:
I don't think we should use a base class for a few utility methods. They could become static methods in a utility class instead.
They only one that is extensively used is map anyway. list is used once in each subclass, and set is completely unused.

nodes.bodyText: All methods except fromFixture can be private. fromFixture should consequently be moved to the top of the class.

commit.message: Removing method which is deprecated since 3.2.
Provide initial implementation of views code for ES7.
Properly include search source in request.
Use correct types to differentiate between buckets and aggregations for ES7 pivot.
Using `fixedInterval` instead of deprecated `dateHistogramInterval`.
Adding/fixing tests for ES7 views.
Adjusting tests to mocking our client wrapper.
Fixing handling of all messages time range for effective time range.
Adjusting exception format.
Removing unused fixtures, making assertions more robust.
Removing unadaptable test.
Removing support for multiple query backends based on type.
Adding backwards-compatible constructor.
Adding events index mapping for ES7.
Removing invalid assertion.
Adjust test to `template` -> `index_patterns` change for index mapping templates.
Simplifying condition in index mapping factory.
Fixing extraction of document count from initial search result.
A couple of cleanups.
Some more cleanups.
Getting rid of base class.
Adapting to changes from ES 7.8.0
Always return exact number of hits.
Fixing accidental change.
